alert.note: Alert for Marinette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 10:42AM CDT until further notice by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan...Wisconsin... Menominee River near McAllister affecting Marinette and Menominee Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Prairie River near Merrill affecting Lincoln County. Pine River near Florence affecting Florence County. Pike River near Amberg affecting Marinette County. Menominee River below Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain affecting Florence, Dickinson, Menominee and Marinette Counties. Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Florence, Dickinson, Forest and Iron Counties. For the Menominee River...including Twin Falls Dam-Iron Mountain, Florence, Vulcan, Niagara, Pembine, Menominee River at White Rapids Dam, Koss, McAllister...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Pike River near Amberg. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, which is flood stage...flooding affects are mainly confined to areas west of Amberg along Highway V. Between 6.5 feet and 8.0 feet...water covers an adjacent park near the the Highway V bridge. A foot bridge near the bridge may be under several feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 7.2 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 6.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
